Articles.Content:
Today a manned Soyuz will laucn to the ISS carrying the crew for expedition 44.

Launch time: 2102 GMT 5:02 p.m. EDT

[Oleg Kononenko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oleg_Kononenko)

[Kimiya Yui](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kimiya_Yui)

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kjell_N._Lindgren](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kjell_N._Lindgren)

Place to watch it live:

NASA TV HD on youtube

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/wyMOYHiatos?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

[NASA TV website](http://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/nasatv/)

[Spaceflightnow.com](http://spaceflightnow.com/2015/07/22/exp44-mission-status-center/)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-22T21:14:35Z" title="07/22/2015 09:14  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 22, 2015</time> by Albert VDS**
This is actually my first time watching a manned rocket launch live. So exciting.
Man....Soyuz capsule is really cramped, even when carrying crew of two.
3 minutes to launch!
I hope Russians used enough struts ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Tuned in and the first thing the guy says is "Two minutes to launch."

Timing FTW.
R2D2 toy? I would have preferred Fuzzy Dice but ok.

> 
> R2D2 toy? I would have preferred Fuzzy Dice but ok.

Or a Kerbal. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

1 minute!

thought it is a crew of 3?

Edit: lift off looks good.

Edit 2: you tube chat is horrible.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-22T21:06:25Z" title="07/22/2015 09:06  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 22, 2015</time> by RainDreamer**
Liftoff!
Flight is looking good ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Good luck Soyuz.
First time watching a Soyuz launch for me. Sure does look cramped, but at least R2 seems to be enjoying himself.
That stage separation animation looked very familiar. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

They look a bit bored.

![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
R2 in freefall ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Orbit achieved.

> 
> R2 in freefall ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Orbit achieved.

The R2 unit is by far the most complicated piece of equipment on the flight ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
One of the solar arrays may not have deployed. ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)
Sounds like there was a problem with 1 of the solar panel array?
What is the problem with the second solar array deployment? Has it been solved yet?

> 
> Man....Soyuz capsule is really cramped, even when carrying crew of two.

It's actually a crew of three...

Nice launch ! Loved to see R2 floating free after third stage cutoff (wich looked quite brutal btw). ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I think they just deploy 1 at a time?
it is deployed, everything is nominal.
Looks like both arrays are good after all. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Hypothetically, would they have been okay with just one panel open?
